intro: Arracacia elata, commonly known as the tall arracacha, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and celery, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are the primary part used, though the leaves are also edible. Arracacia elata is valued for its nutritional content and is used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
